title: FS: Unique RPPC Erie PA Team Heading to the Park - Old Cars, Streetcar (SOLD)
author: Jobu

posts.post_title: FS: Unique RPPC Erie PA Team Heading to the Park - Old Cars, Streetcar (SOLD)
posts.post_content:
[STRIKE]$100[/STRIKE] (SOLD) net to me.

The only item for sale here is the RPPC of the baseball team - the others are for the story.

The stamp box is partially covered, but the AZO stamp with 4 triangles pointing up dates from 1904-1918.

This is from Erie, Pennsylvania, and shows an apparent parade for the baseball team heading to the park, including a streetcar in the back.

There is another street view postcard (not included in this lot) that shows this exact same intersection - check the buildings on the left side - and a map (also not included) showing the intersection and trolley track.

[IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=514667&d=1651368902[/IMG]

[IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=514668&d=1651368911[/IMG]
Bryan, is that Boston Store on the map the same as on the back of the 1917 cards (Ruth year 2)? Regardless, I think this history is totally awesome. Good luck with the sale!

Thanks Ryan!

I can't say for sure about Boston Store, but I think it probably is the same chain. 

[quote name="Rhotchkiss" post=2067316]Bryan, is that Boston Store on the map the same as on the back of the 1917 cards (Ruth year 2)? Regardless, I think this history is totally awesome. Good luck with the sale![/QUOTE]
Trying again for this unique RPPC.
